docs.text: package thing docs welcome to best docs ever
docs.title: home

docs.text: install install script does pretty much everything so just run /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/packagedingus/install/refs/heads/main/install.sh)" yes, the command is stolen from homebrew. by the way, if you are running zsh, run this instead /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/packagedingus/install/refs/heads/main/z.sh)"
docs.title: install

docs.text: install script does pretty much everything so just run /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/packagedingus/install/refs/heads/main/install.sh)" yes, the command is stolen from homebrew. by the way, if you are running zsh, run this instead /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/packagedingus/install/refs/heads/main/z.sh)"
docs.title: install

docs.text: how to publish packages do you have a github account? if no, create one how to create an issue at packagething/packages with this template: Name: packagename Version: "1.0.0" url: "package-url.package/package.tar.gz" faq how do i make a tar.gz? 7zip, winrar, any zip creator pretty much that supports tar.gz why did my [horrible] package get declined? put effort into a package. if you don't, it won't get accepted, no exceptions. how do i update my package? make another issue, with a new version, but name and url the same, and add the "update" label. the bot is broken! submit an issue at packagething/error , and make sure it's actually a bug first.
docs.title: publish packages

docs.text: do you have a github account? if no, create one
